content:
| Category | Information |
| --- | --- |
| Localization strategy | Maserati has a global localization strategy to reach customers in different markets with localized content. |
| Teams | Maserati has a dedicated team of localization experts and translators to handle their translations. |
| TMS | Maserati uses a Translation Management System (TMS) to streamline their translation process and ensure consistency. |
| MT | Maserati uses Machine Translation (MT) to speed up the translation process and reduce costs. |
| TM | Maserati has a Translation Memory (TM) to store translated content for future use, ensuring consistency and accuracy. |
| API | Maserati uses APIs to connect their systems and automate their translation workflows. |
| CMS Integration | Maserati integrates their TMS with their Content Management System (CMS) to streamline their translation process. |
| Security | Maserati follows strict security protocols to protect their content and customer data. |
| Standards and Guidelines | Maserati has established translation standards and guidelines to ensure consistency and quality in their localized content. |
| I18N tools | Maserati uses internationalization (I18N) tools to prepare their content for translation and ensure compatibility with different languages and regions. |
| Methods and Models | Maserati uses various translation methods and models to ensure the accuracy and cultural appropriateness of their localized content. |
| Workflows | Maserati has established translation workflows to ensure that the translation process is efficient and effective. |
| TMS Customization | Maserati customizes their TMS to meet their specific translation needs and workflows. |
| Techniques | Maserati uses various translation techniques, such as transcreation and cultural adaptation, to ensure that their content is appropriate and effective in different markets. |
| Reporting and Analytics | Maserati uses reporting and analytics tools to track and analyze the effectiveness of their translations and make data-driven decisions. |
| Vendors | Maserati works with translation vendors to supplement their internal localization team and ensure quality translations. |
| Reviews/LQA | Maserati conducts reviews and Language Quality Assurance (LQA) checks to ensure the accuracy and quality of their translations. |
| Scalability | Maserati's translation process is scalable to handle large volumes of content and multiple languages. |
| User Friendliness | Maserati's translation process is designed to be user-friendly and accessible to their internal teams and translation vendors. |
| Cost | Maserati manages translation costs by using a combination of internal resources and external vendors, as well as utilizing MT to reduce costs. |
| User/License Limits | Maserati has established user and license limits to control access to their translation systems and ensure data security. |
| Collaboration | Maserati encourages collaboration between their internal teams and external vendors to ensure effective communication and collaboration. |
| Support | Maserati provides support for their translation systems and workflows to ensure that their internal teams and vendors have the resources they need. |
| Supported Content Types | Maserati translates a variety of content types, including marketing materials, technical documentation, and legal documents. |
| Roles and Permissions | Maserati establishes roles and permissions to control access to their translation systems and ensure data security. |
